header_summary:
Ava Chow announced the release of Bitcoin Core version 28.1, emphasizing its new features, bug fixes, and performance improvements for Linux, macOS, and Windows platforms. This update, available for download on [Bitcoin Core's official website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-28.1), also introduces changes to peer-to-peer configurations and advises users on the upgrade process from older versions, underscoring the software's commitment to enhancing user experience and system efficiency.

Jameson Lopp raised concerns about the reliability of timestamp data in Bitcoin transactions, specifically nLockTime, warning against a potential vulnerability that adversaries could exploit to unfairly benefit from transaction prioritization rules. This discussion, part of the Bitcoin Development Mailing List, calls for further deliberation on securing transaction timestamp integrity to prevent a "race to the bottom" scenario, thereby maintaining the effectiveness of new prioritization rules. The conversation underscores the need for ongoing vigilance and adaptation within the Bitcoin network to address emergent issues.

Technical discussions by ademan and sjors delve into optimizing transaction processes and managing blockchain data storage, respectively. Ademan proposes integrating the settlement transaction directly into the final update of an @ademan channel to streamline settlement times, while sjors highlights challenges of data fragmentation and unwanted data storage on the Bitcoin network, suggesting Utreexo as a solution for maintaining a clean and efficient storage system. These discussions, found on platforms like [DelvingBitcoin.org](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/contract-level-relative-timelocks-or-lets-talk-about-ancestry-proofs-and-singletons/1353/17) and [GitHub](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27050), reflect the community's commitment to technical improvements and efficiency in the blockchain ecosystem.

recent_posts.summary:

- This approach, reminiscent of Daric, could reduce the transaction delay to `(N - 1) * shared_delay`.
- Implementing this strategy promises significant improvement in channel settlement times.
